content: stay close cowl this is a simple easy but fun to knit cowl knit in drops air a fluffy soft blown worsted/aran weight yarn the cowl is great for gift knits transitional months a quick in-between project and much more knit up as many as you d like it s a one skein project so you can use any yarn you d like you ll need at least 100 yards this cowl is great for beginners and advanced knitters alike yarn i used drops air 164 yards worsted/aran weight in color purple haze feel free to use any worsted weight-bulky yarn you would like you will need about 100 yards or less/more depending on gauge and/or modifications 1 needles size 7 us 16 inch circular knitting needles use needles that will fit your yarn choice since gauge doesn t matter much for this project gauge gauge doesn t matter too much but will affect how much yarn you use and the finished size of your cowl 17 sts and 28 rounds over 4 inches in knit 1 purl 1 rib in the round finished size unblocked approximately 9 5 wide and 5 tall with the edges rolled if gauge is met note if you would like your cowl to be wider just cast on a larger even number and follow the pattern as usual cowl cast on 82 sts using your preferred method of choice do not join to work in the round yet knit 1 row place a bor marker and join to work in the round making sure that the sts are not twisted knit 3 rounds *round 1 knit 1 purl 1 to end of round work this last round a total of 7 times or until your work measures 1 inch from the start of that rib section round 2 knit all sts round 3 purl 1 knit 1 to end of round 2 work this last round for a total of 7 times or the number of rounds you worked for the first rib section round 4 knit all sts * repeat these four last pattern rounds * to * until your cowl measures 5 5 inches from the cast on edge or your desired length ending with the last row of the repeat a knit round knit 2 rounds bind off all sts using your preferred method of choice making sure that the bind off is not too loose weave in all yarn ends and block your finished cowl if you would like abbreviations sts stitches bor beginning of round thank you so much for following one of my patterns it fills me with joy to see finished projects made from any of my patterns simplestitchesdesigns 2025 3
